page.title: 15BISHOPS LYDEARD'S CHARTER
page.content:
On June 7th,1291 King Edward ! granted to the Bishop of Bath and Wells,in whose diocese it lay,a Charter granting Bishops Lydeard its Fair and Market days.The Charter ,still bearing its royal seal, can be seen in the Parish Church of St.Mary the Virgin.
'....shall hold in perpetuity a market every Monday in their manor of Bishops Lydeard in the County of Somerset,one fair annually lasting for six days...the day and the morrow of the feast of the Nativity of the Blessed Mary and three days following and...the day and the morrow of the feast of the Annunciation of the Blessed Mary and the three days following,providing that the market and fairs do not harm neighbouring markets and fairs.'
